metadata.title: CVE-2018-12371 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
An integer overflow vulnerability in the Skia library when allocatingmemory for edge builders on some systems with at least 16 GB of RAM. Thisresults in the use of uninitialized memory, resulting in a potentiallyexploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 60.1,Thunderbird < 60, and Firefox < 61.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-12371` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 61.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 61.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 61.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 61.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '61.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
